au.gov.sbr.xml
Class XMLUtils

java.lang.Object
  au.gov.sbr.xml.XMLUtils

public class XMLUtils
extends java.lang.Object

A utility class that supports common XML operations for SOAP and WS Security.

Nested Class Summary
static class XMLUtils.SBRSecurityNamespaceContext
          This class implements the NamespaceContext interface to adhere to SBR Security standard protocol.
static class XMLUtils.SoapVersion
          Enumerates SOAP Versions

Takes a String containing an XML document and returns a DOM representation of the XML document.

importXML

public static void importXML(org.w3c.dom.Document destination,
                             org.w3c.dom.Element source,
                             java.lang.String location)
Attaches the XML in source to the XML in destination as a child of the node specified by the XPath expression in location.

Note about namespaces. Only the following namespaces are supported at this time:
soap - http://www.w3.org/2003/05/soap-envelope
wsse - http://docs.oasis-open.org/wss/2004/oasis-200401-wss-wsssecurity-secext -1.0.xsd
ds - http://www.w3.org/2000/09/xmldsig#

Parameters:
destination - the destination XML.
source - the XML fragment to import, must be a valid XML document.
location - an XPath expression that will return a NODE value.
Throws:
java.lang.RuntimeException - if any exception is thrown.

importXML

public static void importXML(org.w3c.dom.Document destination,
                             org.w3c.dom.Document source,
                             java.lang.String location)
Attaches the XML in source to the XML in destination as a child of the node specified by the XPath expression in location.

Note about namespaces. Only the following namespaces are supported at this time:
soap - http://www.w3.org/2003/05/soap-envelope
wsse - http://docs.oasis-open.org/wss/2004/oasis-200401-wss-wsssecurity-secext -1.0.xsd
ds - http://www.w3.org/2000/09/xmldsig#

Parameters:
destination - the destination XML.
source - the XML fragment to import, must be a valid XML document.
location - an XPath expression that will return a NODE value.

importXML

public static java.lang.String importXML(java.lang.String destination,
                                         java.lang.String source,
                                         java.lang.String location)
Attaches the XML in source to the XML in destination as a child of the node specified by the XPath expression in location.

Note about namespaces. Only the following namespaces are supported at this time:
soap - http://www.w3.org/2003/05/soap-envelope
wsse - http://docs.oasis-open.org/wss/2004/oasis-200401-wss-wsssecurity-secext -1.0.xsd
ds - http://www.w3.org/2000/09/xmldsig#

Parameters:
destination - the destination XML.
source - the XML fragment to import, must be a valid XML document.
location - an XPath expression that will return a NODE value.
Returns:
the XML document with source attached to destination at location.

findNode

public static org.w3c.dom.Node findNode(org.w3c.dom.Document doc,
                                        java.lang.String location)
Finds and returns the Node in the XML document with a child of the node specified by the XPath expression in location.

Parameters:
doc - the XML fragment to scan, must be a valid XML document.
location - an XPath expression that will return a NODE value.
Returns:
the node at the specified location.
Throws:
java.lang.RuntimeException - if any exception is thrown.

Parameters:

isId - boolean indicating ID status.

getOnlyChildElementOrCreateNewNS

public static org.w3c.dom.Element getOnlyChildElementOrCreateNewNS(org.w3c.dom.Element element,
                                                                   java.lang.String namespaceURI,
                                                                   java.lang.String localName)
Looks up a single child element or creates one if it does not exist. This method will throw an unchecked exception if more than one child element is found.

Parameters:
element - the parent element.
namespaceURI - the namespace for the child element.
localName - the local name for the child element.
Returns:
the child element.

getOnlyChildElementOrCreateNewNS

public static org.w3c.dom.Element getOnlyChildElementOrCreateNewNS(org.w3c.dom.Element element,
                                                                   java.lang.String namespaceURI,
                                                                   java.lang.String localName,
                                                                   java.lang.String prefix)
Looks up a single child element or creates one if it does not exist. This method will throw an unchecked exception if more than one child element is found.

Parameters:
element - the parent element.
namespaceURI - the namespace for the child element.
localName - the local name for the child element.
prefix - an optional prefix for the child element if it needs to be created.
Returns:
the child element.

the child element.
